result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad L. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad L. Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad L. Rogers was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber; credit to be computed by jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad L. Rogers in court with attorney Ronald N Walker.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation:  Cts 2 & 3: dismissed.  Ct 1: 5 days jail, with Huber, credit to be computed by jail; $1429 fine/cost; $20 cps; 12 mo DLR; 12 mo IID; AODA & dsp.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
